text: It was very late and everyone had left the cafe except an old man who sat in the shadow the leaves of the tree made against the electric light.
label: None

text: In the day time the street was dusty, but at night the dew settled the dust and the old man liked to sit late because he was deaf and now at night it was quiet and he felt the difference.
label: None

text: The two waiters inside the cafe knew that the old man was a little drunk, and while he was a good client they knew that if he became too drunk he would leave without paying, so they kept watch on him.
label: None

text: Last week he tried to commit suicide, one waiter said.
label: None

text: Why?
label: None

text: He was in despair.
label: None

text: What about?
Nothing.
label: None

text: How do you know it was nothing?
label: None

text: He has plenty of money.
label: None

text: They sat together at a table that was close against the wall near the door of the cafe and looked at the terrace where the tables were all empty except where the old man sat in the shadow of the leaves of the tree that moved slightly in the wind.
label: None

text: A girl and a soldier went by in the street.
label: None

text: The street light shone on the brass number on his collar.
label: None

text: The girl wore no head covering and hurried beside him.
label: None

text: The guard will pick him up, one waiter said.
label: None

text: What does it matter if he gets what he's after?
He had better get off the street now.
label: None

text: The guard will get him.
label: None

text: They went by five minutes ago.
label: None

text: The old man sitting in the shadow rapped on his saucer with his glass.
label: None

text: The younger waiter went over to him.
label: None

text: What do you want?
The old man looked at him.
label: None

text: Another brandy, he said.
label: None

text: You'll be drunk, the waiter said.
label: None

text: The old man looked at him.
label: None

text: The waiter went away.
label: None

text: He'll stay all night, he said to his colleague.
label: None

text: I'm sleepy now.
label: None

text: I never get into bed before three o'clock.
label: None

text: He should have killed himself last week.
label: None

text: The waiter took the brandy bottle and another saucer from the counter inside the cafe and marched out to the old man's table.
label: None

text: He put down the saucer and poured the glass full of brandy.
label: None

text: You should have killed yourself last week, he said to the deaf man.
label: None

text: The old man motioned with his finger.
label: None

text: A little more, he said.
label: None

text: The waiter poured on into the glass so that the brandy slopped over and ran down the stem into the top saucer of the pile.
label: None

text: Thank you, the old man said.
label: None

text: The waiter took the bottle back inside the cafe.
label: None

text: He sat down at the table with his colleague again.
label: None

text: He's drunk now, he said.
label: None

text: He's drunk every night.
label: None

text: What did he want to kill himself for?
How should I know.
label: None

text: How did he do it?
label: None

text: He hung himself with a rope.
label: None

text: Who cut him down?
label: None

text: His niece.
label: None

text: Why did they do it?
label: None

text: Fear for his soul.
label: None

text: How much money has he got?
label: None

text: He's got plenty.
label: None

text: He must be eighty years old.
label: None

text: Anyway I should say he was eighty.
label: None

text: I wish he would go home.
label: None

text: I never get to bed before three o'clock.
label: None

text: What kind of hour is that to go to bed?
label: None

text: He stays up because he likes it.
label: None

text: He's lonely.
label: None

text: I'm not lonely.
label: None

text: I have a wife waiting in bed for me.
label: None

text: He had a wife once too.
label: None

text: A wife would be no good to him now.
label: None

text: You can't tell.
label: None

text: He might be better with a wife.
label: None

text: His niece looks after him.
label: None

text: You said she cut him down.
label: None

text: I know.
label: None

text: I wouldn't want to be that old.
label: None

text: An old man is a nasty thing.
label: None

text: Not always.
label: None

text: This old man is clean.
label: None

text: He drinks without spilling.
label: None

text: Even now, drunk.
label: None

text: Look at him.
label: None

text: I don't want to look at him.
label: None

text: I wish he would go home.
label: None

text: He has no regard for those who must work.
label: None

text: The old man looked from his glass across the square, then over at the waiters.
label: None

text: Another brandy, he said, pointing to his glass.
label: None

text: The waiter who was in a hurry came over.
label: None

text: Finished, he said, speaking with that omission of syntax stupid people employ when talking to drunken people or foreigners.
label: None

text: No more tonight.
label: None

text: Close now.
label: None

text: Another, said the old man.
label: None

text: No.
label: None

text: Finished.
label: None

text: The waiter wiped the edge of the table with a towel and shook his head.
label: None

text: The old man stood up, slowly counted the saucers, took a leather coin purse from his pocket and paid for the drinks, leaving half a peseta tip.
label: None

text: The waiter watched him go down the street, a very old man walking unsteadily but with dignity.
label: None

text: Why didn't you let him stay and drink?
label: None

text: the unhurried waiter asked.
label: None

text: Theywere putting up the shutters.
label: None

text: It is not half-past two.
label: None

text: I want to go home to bed.
label: None

text: What is an hour?
label: None

text: More to me than to him.
label: None

text: An hour is the same.
label: None

text: You talk like an old man yourself.
label: None

text: He can buy a bottle and drink at home.
label: None

text: It's not the same.
label: None

text: No, it is not, agreed the waiter with a wife.
label: None

text: He did not wish to be unjust.
label: None

text: He was only in a hurry.
label: None

text: And you?
label: None

text: You have no fear of going home before your usual hour?
label: None

text: Are you trying to insult me?
label: None

text: No, hombre, only to make a joke.
label: None

text: No, the waiter who was in a hurry said, rising from pulling down the metal shutters.
label: None

text: I have confidence.
label: None

text: I am all confidence.
label: None

text: You have youth, confidence, and a job, the older waiter said.
label: None

text: You have everything.
label: None

text: And what do you lack?
label: None

text: Everything but work.
label: None

text: You have everything I have.
label: None

text: No.
label: None

text: I have never had confidence and I am not young.
label: None

text: Come on.
label: None

text: Stop talking nonsense and lock up.
label: None

text: I am of those who like to stay late at the cafe, the older waiter said.
label: None

text: With all those who do not want to go to bed.
label: None

text: With all those who need a light for the night.
label: None

text: I want to go home and into bed.
label: None

text: We are of two different kinds, the older waiter said.
label: None

text: He was now dressed to go home.
label: None

text: It is not only a question of youth and confidence although those things are very beautiful.
label: None

text: Each night I am reluctant to close up because there may be some one who needs the cafe.
label: None

text: Hombre, there are bodegas open all night long.
label: None

text: You do not understand.
label: None

text: This is a clean and pleasant cafe.
label: None

text: It is well lighted.
label: None

text: The light is very good and also, now, there are shadows of the leaves.
label: None

text: Good night, said the younger waiter.
label: None

text: Good night, the other said.
label: None

text: Turning off the electric light he continued the conversation with himself.
label: None

text: It was the light of course but it is necessary that the place be clean and pleasant.
label: None

text: You do not want music.
label: None

text: Certainly you do not want music.
label: None

text: Nor can you stand before a bar with dignity although that is all that is provided for these hours.
label: None

text: What did he fear?
label: None

text: It was not a fear or dread.
label: None

text: It was a nothing that he knew too well.
label: None

text: It was all a nothing and a man was a nothing too.
label: None

text: It was only that and light was all it needed and a certain cleanness and order.
label: None

text: Some lived in it and never felt it but he knew it all was nada y pues nada y nada y pues nada.
label: None

text: Our nada who art in nada, nada be thy name thy kingdom nada thy will be nada in nada as it is in nada.
label: None

text: Give us this nada our daily nada and nada us our nada as we nada our nadas and nada us not into nada but deliver us from nada; pues nada.
label: None

text: Hail nothing full of nothing, nothing is with thee.
label: None

text: He smiled and stood before a bar with a shining steam pressure coffee machine.
label: None

text: What's yours? asked the barman.
label: None

text: Nada.
label: None

text: Otro loco mas, said the barman and turned away.
label: None

text: A little cup, said the waiter.
label: None

text: The barman poured it for him.
label: None

text: The light is very bright and pleasant but the bar is unpolished, the waiter said.
label: None

text: The barman looked at him but did not answer.
label: None

text: It was too late at night for conversation.
label: None

text: You want another copita? the barman asked.
label: None

text: No, thank you, said the waiter and went out.
label: None

text: He disliked bars and bodegas.
label: None

text: A clean, well-lighted cafe was a very different thing.
label: None

text: Now, without thinking further, he would go home to his room.
label: None

text: He would lie in the bed and finally, with daylight, he would go to sleep.
label: None

text: After all, he said to himself, it's probably only insomnia.
label: None

text: Many must have it.
label: None
